com.analog.lyric.dimple.exceptions

Class DimpleException

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • java.lang.Exception
        • java.lang.RuntimeException
          • com.analog.lyric.dimple.exceptions.DimpleException
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class DimpleException
extends java.lang.RuntimeException
    Base class for new exception types thrown by Dimple library.

    Note that since it is derived from RuntimeException these exceptions are not checked and do not have to be listed in throws clauses for methods.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • unsupportedMethod

        public static DimpleException unsupportedMethod(java.lang.Class<?> cl,
                                java.lang.String name)
        Returns an exception indicating a method is not supported
        Parameters:
        cl - is the class from which the exception was thrown. Usually it is sufficient to use Object.getClass().
        name - is the name of the method.
        See Also:
        unsupportedMethod(Class, String, String)

      • unsupportedMethod

        public static DimpleException unsupportedMethod(java.lang.Class<?> cl,
                                java.lang.String name,
                                java.lang.String reason)
        Returns an exception indicating a method is not supported
        Parameters:
        cl - is the class from which the exception was thrown. Usually it is sufficient to use Object.getClass().
        name - is the name of the method.
        reason - states the reason the method is unsupported in sentence form
        See Also:
        unsupportedMethod(Class, String)

      • unsupportedBySolver

        public static DimpleException unsupportedBySolver(java.lang.String solver,
                                  java.lang.String operation)
        Creates an exception stating that specified operation is not supported by a particular solver.
